title: 02. Development of Democracy
description: The evolution of Athenian democracy from Solon to Pericles and the impact of key reforms.

questions.question: Why was Solon appointed eponymous archon in 594/3 BCE?
options: To prevent revolution through social reform

questions.question: Which group formed the richest class in Solon’s property divisions?
Which political right did Solon grant to all citizens regardless of class?
options: The right to attend the ekklēsia
The right to serve as strategos

questions.question: Under Solon, where did most political power remain concentrated?
options: The archons and the Council of the Areopagus

questions.question: What major administrative reform did Cleisthenes introduce?
options: The division of citizens into ten tribes
The citizenship law of two Athenian parents

questions.question: What was the size and structure of the boulē created by Cleisthenes?
options: 500 members with 50 from each tribe annually

questions.question: What military obligation was tied to Cleisthenes’ tribal system?
options: Each tribe provided a regiment led by a strategos

questions.question: What was the significance of selecting archons by lot from 487–486 BCE?
options: It increased the power of the strategoi
It reduced elite dominance of the Areopagus

questions.question: How did the Persian Wars affect democratic development in Athens?
options: They increased the political importance of the lower classes

questions.question: Which group gained influence due to service in the navy during the Persian Wars?
What office did Pericles hold repeatedly from 443 BCE?
Which reform is attributed to Ephialtes in 462/1 BCE?
options: Reduction of the powers of the Areopagus

questions.question: Which new responsibility did the Areopagus retain after Ephialtes’ reforms?
options: Jurisdiction over murder and religious offences

questions.question: What democratic reform is associated with Pericles to increase participation?
What was the effect of Pericles’ citizenship law?
options: It reduced the role of women
It restricted citizenship to those with two Athenian parents

questions.question: What exception did Pericles later seek after the plague?
options: To grant citizenship to his sons by Aspasia
